body:
As I am so fond of saying, Voat Already Has ThisÂ©

I often use markup in my posts, image links and quotes and text formatting, and sometimes I'd like to see how it will all turn out before committing my comment. Voat has a Preview button next to Submit, which then shows below the comment box what your comment will look like to other users. That's a really nice feature and I think Ruqqus should straight up steal it from those evil Nazi Voaters. 

As I understand it, this would be a huge bitch to implement on the site AND on the app, but yall should add it to your honeydo list. Thanks for coming to my TED Talk.
body_html:
As I am so fond of saying, Voat Already Has ThisÂ©

I often use markup in my posts, image links and quotes and text formatting, and sometimes I'd like to see how it will all turn out before committing my comment. Voat has a Preview button next to Submit, which then shows below the comment box what your comment will look like to other users. That's a really nice feature and I think Ruqqus should straight up steal it from those evil Nazi Voaters.

As I understand it, this would be a huge bitch to implement on the site AND on the app, but yall should add it to your honeydo list. Thanks for coming to my TED Talk.

title: Preview Button for Text Posts and Comments Please

body: That would be a really good idea. We could check if our comments have the correct formatting, so we don't have to edit them after messing up.
body_html: That would be a really good idea. We could check if our comments have the correct formatting, so we don't have to edit them after messing up.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

body:
This would be nice for the future, especially for beginners. However, the devs are very busy atm and this can wait a while unless anyone wants to commit it to the github themselves, which I'm sure would be fine.

In the meantime, I think it'd be better if this were implemented as part of +RuqES instead. It's the Ruqqus equivalent of RES, which actually had the same feature for reddit.
body_html:
This would be nice for the future, especially for beginners. However, the devs are very busy atm and this can wait a while unless anyone wants to commit it to the github themselves, which I'm sure would be fine.

In the meantime, I think it'd be better if this were implemented as part of +RuqES instead. It's the Ruqqus equivalent of RES, which actually had the same feature for reddit.
